cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles W of the Dry Tortugas
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then turning north toward the Florida Panhandle with inland track through Alabama and Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle / northern Gulf Coast (near the AL-FL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch runs Alabama/Florida border east to Ochlockonee River, FL (northern Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (warnings expected later for northern Gulf Coast, not GA)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf Coast from AL through FL Panhandle; inland Alabama and Georgia (including southeast GA) for rain/flooding
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible Tuesday with peak sustained 20-30 mph, occasional gale-force gusts (<34 kt probability only 3%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic Georgia coast
weather_observation.rainfall: 3-6 inches possible with isolated 9 inch totals leading to urban and small-stream flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible inland Georgia as the system moves through
